description:
When you learn a new language, like French or German or even English,
you first learn how to read. Then you learn how to write. When you learn
a new *programming* language, you first learn how to write. And that’s
it.

Imagine that you were never formally taught how to read. And that you
were told that you should just figure it out … by writing … a whole
bunch. How would that even work? I don’t think it would.

If you can’t read. You can’t write. It’s that simple.

Do you think that Shakespeare would be Shakespeare if he never read a
single book in his entire life? No. Nothing is created in a vacuum. Good
writers are good writers because they’re good readers.

Just as reading is an invaluable skill so to is reading code. It’s a
skill that’s never formally taught. But it’s a skill that is essential
nonetheless. In this talk I’ll show you how to effectively read code so
that might write better code.
title: How to read (code)
